parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear wheel bearing can cause the rear wheel to lock up, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injury or death.
symptoms: Abnormal noise or chirping sound coming from the rear of the vehicle
drive belt riding abnormally on the rear drive pulley
rear wheel bearings and support shaft in need of replacement.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel pump mounting plate can cause fuel to leak from the tank, creating a fire hazard, especially in enclosed spaces.
symptoms: Fuel leak from the tank
uncontrolled fuel escape
fuel smell
potential fire hazard.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the CANBUS system can cause critical safety systems, such as the speedometer, tachometer, and ABS, to malfunction, leading to a loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: Sudden loss of instrument cluster functionality
speedometer and tachometer failure
ABS failure
engine stalling
burning smell and smoke from the alternator.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine stalling and cutting out while the motorcycle is in motion can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to serious injuries or fatalities, especially when approaching corners, stop signs, or slowing down.
symptoms: The engine stalls or cuts out unpredictably
often when downshifting or completely closing the throttle
particularly after riding at high throttle settings or after reaching a certain mileage (50-85 miles). The problem may occur at various speeds
from 5mph to 60mph.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Wheel Bearing Seizure and Catastrophic Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The seizure of the rear wheel bearing can cause a catastrophic wheel separation from the pulley and belt drive, leading to a loss of control and potentially resulting in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The rear wheel bearing seizes
causing the wheel to separate from the pulley and belt drive
rusting or welding together with the shaft
unusual noises or vibrations from the rear wheel
loss of control or stability while riding.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden loss of front brake pressure can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents or near-miss situations, especially when driving on rough roads or construction zones.
symptoms: When braking on rough surfaces
the ABS system releases all front brake pressure
resulting in a loss of braking power
the vehicle takes longer to stop
or the vehicle pulls to one side while braking.
